ing: 8 pounds apples - peeled, cored, and sliced
2 teaspoons water, or more as needed
des: "This was my first attempt at canning anything. Ever. I shouldn't have worried so much about preserving it. Everyone we gave this to as gifts one week ago has already finished theirs! Be prepared to dream of food as the whole house will smell like apple pie overnight as this cooks."
ins:
Place apples in a slow cooker.
Stir white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt together in a bowl; pour over apples. Add enough water to moisten apples.
Cook on Low, overnight or 10 hours.
Stir vanilla extract into apples. Cook, uncovered, for 2 hours more.
